title: Patterns of change in design metaphor: a case study
proctitle: CHI '98: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: William A. Stubblefield
authors.institution: Sandia National Laboratories, P.O. Box 5800, Albuquerque, New Mexico

references.text: Carroll, J., R. Mack, and W. Kellogg, Interface metaphors and user interface design, in Handbook of Human Computer Interaction, Hellander, Editor. 1988, Elsevier: Amsterdam.
Erickson, T., Working with interface metaphors, in The Art of Human-Computer Interface Design, B. Laurel, Editor. 1990, Addison-Wesley: Reading, Mass.
Maclean, A., et al. Reaching through analogy: A design rationale perspect&e on roles of analogy, in CHI-91. 1991. New Orleans: Addison Wesley.
Madsen, K.H., A Guide to Metaphorical Design. Communications of the ACM, 1994. 37(12): p. 57- 62.
Coyne, R., Designing Information Technology in the Postmodern Age: From Method to Metaphor. 1995, Cambridge, Mass.: The MIT Press.
Black, M., Models and Metaphors. 1962, Ithaca, NY: Comell University Press.
Lakoff, G. and M. Johnson, Metaphors We Live By. 1980, Chicago: University of Chicago Press.
Gibbs, R.W.J., The Poetics of Mind. 1994, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
Hesse, M., Models and Analogies in Science. 1966, Notre Dame, Indiana: University of Notre Dame Press.
Gentner, D., Flowing waters or teaming crowds: Mental models of electricity, in Mental Models, D. Gentner and A.L. Stevens, Editor. 1983, Lawrence Elbaum Associates: Hillsdale, N. J.
Stubblefield, W.A., Source Selection for Analogical Reasoning: An Interactionist Approach. 1995, University of New Mexico:
Gentner, D., Structure mapping: A theoretical framework for analogy. Cognitive Science, 1983. (7): p. 155-170.
Kuhn, T.S., The Structure of Scientific Revolutions. 1962, Chicago: University of Chicago Press.
Laurel, B., Computers as Theater. 1991, Reading, MA: Addison-Wesley.
